event.location: Bomb placed in a flowerbed underneath the front entrance widows
event.summary: 9/10/1993: Unknown perpetrators bombed the Family Planning Associates clinic in Newport Beach, California, United States. There were no casualties but the building sustained around $3,500 in damages.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in California.
event.weapdetail: Authorities were unsure of exactly what type of explosive device was used, but a plastic gas can filled with liquid was discovered at the scene.
event.addnotes: The bombing took place overnight and the abortion clinic was forced to open late the following day. One day after the incident, the healthcare facility received a bomb threat. Authorities were unsure whether this threat was related to the bombing.
event.scite1: Greg Hernandez, "Newport Beach: Threat Follows Blast at Abortion Clinic," Los Angeles Times, September 15, 1993.
event.scite2: Greg Hernandez and Eric Young, "Bombing Hits Newport Beach Abortion Clinic," Los Angeles Times, September 11, 1993.
event.scite3: "Attacks on the West Coast," The Oregonian, January 31, 1994.
